data.title: Episode 20: One on one with U17s girls Nz national Champion and MVP Jayzelee WaihiüèÄ by Showtime Balling
data.meta_description: This is apart of the she got game series. We catch up with Jayzelee Waihi representing Waikato who is just fresh off the U17s nationals, where her team won the championship then also recieving the tournament overall MVP. This episode was recorded while she is in the Steven Adams high school invitational camp. We totally appreciate the time this talented, but busy baller has given us.
data.text:
Kahu Treacher is a driven, passionate and well rounded hooper but an even amazing young man. Hard working and goal oriented baller speaks about his timeline and experiences that keeps him elevating. Kahu alongside his supportive whƒÅnau has navigated from representative NZ hoops, USA high school/AAU, NBA without borders and highest honour to date as a junior Tall black. Watch this space as he‚Äôs not done yet.

We catch up with professional NZ hooper Jordan Ngatai. ‚ÄúThe Prince of Porirua‚Äù speaks about his hoop life, multiple NZNBL champion and Tall black. Currently representing the Bay Hawks preparing for the 2023 final 6. We caught up with Jordan live from Kennedy park.

Leanne Walker‚Äôs contribution to the game of basketball as a player, coach and mother is well documented within New Zealand. Many aspiring female athletes she has had a chance develop have moved onto to higher honours, especially around supporting her daughters who have gone on to represent on multiple levels.

We went one on one with Coach Alex Stojkovic who is based in Te Aroha and creator of Shot maker academy. We speak about coaching support throughout the country, coaching training plans and philosophies.

Son and of legendary Tall black Paora Winitana, young Paora speaks on his journey through basketball. Goal setting has played a major role in this young athletes life who has worked hard on and off the court to get to where he is today. The strength in his faith and culture truly makes Paora understand what it takes to proceed through his journey.

Christchurch based basketball skills coach and business man Tyla Harrison-Hunt involvement in basketball within the South Island is low key but vast. Lead of the kaupapa Crossover coach and head of the Lincoln university program, shows his dedication to help our basketball community is far beyond the physical but general well-being is crucial. Our Podcast is powered by the hydration specialist R-LineüèÄ

Taine Murray is a basketball athlete who has achieved alot in his basketball journey. Multiple experiences and accolades most kids only dream of, while also becoming one of the youngest Tall blacks of all time. This episode is proudly powered by R-LINE the hydration specialists.

Arielle Williams-Mackey is a hardworking hooper athlete who has accomplished many great things in the game of basketball. So many layers to Arielle in regards to her development in the game she shares every aspect in detail.

Part one of the pro life with Benny Anthony's experience. This is a raw unedited and unfiltered episode, where we let this former Tall black speak his truth. We go through the ups downs and sideways in Benny's journey in hoops. Warning ‚ö†Ô∏è this episode contains explicit language and real conversations.

The girls step up now1ü•∞ Representing Girls got game is Zaaliyah Kailahi-Fulu and Representing She Got Game we have Alana Paewai. Matchups, coaches and squads are discussed in the lead up to this Allstar clashüí™

Special episode building up the showdown of the battle of the Bombay‚Äôs 5th December in Hamilton. In this episode we have representing the Auckland city allstar ballers bringing the heat is Alex Mcnaught faces off with the GQ Smooth Caleb Smiler representing team Showtimeballing üôå

We speak to Tall Fern Pep Matangiroa Flavell about her journey as a young Rotorua MƒÅori girl with high ambitions and hoop dreams through to the strong wahine she is today. A great story all around the highs and lows in pursuing life goals and to keep preserving no matter how tough life gets.

We speak to Mike Lacey to give us the latest update on Zone one heading towards the road to nationals 2020. We speak about players and teams to watch out for both the boys and girls.

First episode of two with Tall black legend and Auckland based baller. In this episode LT speaks about where his passion for ball came from, intro into hoops, high school ball and Tall blacks.

KB speaks about his balling life up to date as a player and coach also his next move with the Auckland Huskies. Kevin spoke to us while he was in America during covid 19 finishing his studies. Great conversation with one of the best American imports over the last 10 years.

Draft special episode we speak to two coaches with experience in the female high school age group. From Taranaki Shay Haira and the Waikato Anthony Corban. They lend their expertise and comments on how the draft went, captains, matchups and a potential Faceoff between Arielle Williams-Mackey leading She got game and Jayzelee representing team Showtime balling nz.

Part 1 of 2 with Chris Vaughan from Lead scholarship. This program is designed to help young athletes towards gaining a life in the USA college life within sports.

Riva has accomplished so much within her basketball life, she has worked hard to make it to where she is today. Riva speaks about her run in the Waikato association, her high school life and plans to go over to college in the USA.

We speak to 3 past Rosmini college students about their times and life within this basketball program. This episode will give you insight into Rosmini through the stories of our guests, during their ride they experienced junior prem championships back to back national titles and 3 final appearances in a row.

Episode 65: Alonzo Burton son of legendary ex tall black Willie Burton, is looking to pave his own pathway. Alonzos work ethic is top level, and for how young he has accomplished so much.

Andrew has been working up in the north developing young athletes in his program Get better basketball NZ, we lock him down to speak about his passion with üèÄ

Tinashe and his story in ball is the definition of striving for greatness. In this episode he speaks about his humble beginnings, mindset to push through barriers and his T45 apparel brand. This episode is brought to you by our guys over at Skinny fizz, check em outüôå

Ella and Charlisse have been balling together since the beginning of high school, and now they have finished school in this episode they reflect on their journey together.

Coaching collective giving a inside look into the mindsets of coaches around nz. Aik Ho who has a wealth of experience within New Zealand at all levels, join us and speaks about his experience coaching both male and females in basketball.

This is our first episode in our coaching collective. We speak to New Zealands super basketball brain Head coach Zico Coronel, around detailing how to plan for your next season.

Gi Rise is a basketball program based in Glen Innes Auckland. In this episode co founder and coach Sione alongside NBL fan favorite 2019 Dom Kelman Poto, speaks about their program from the beginnings, Hoopnation, passion for basketball and a little competition with our first Faceoff Showtime balling nz quiz.

Hoopnation 2019 was a big success. On this episode we caught up with multiple ballers at the basketball festival in Tauranga. We asked 3 questions 1 How did you find your Hoopnation experience 2 Where does your passion for basketball come from? 3 What's your definition of Showtime in regards to basketball. Order of guest's are as follows. 1 Seth and Jackson from Aucklandballers 2 Coach Shawn Nance from NZ elite 3 Haize Walker from first Chapter 4 Tall ferns Ashleigh Karaitiana and Tessa Boagni 5 Coach Sione Maama GI rise 6 Greg Elliot Rack city 7 Coach Paul Des Tuala-Fata Wellington.

In this episode the man himself speaks about his early days in basketball, his interesting selection into the Tallblacks, NZNBL and ANBL. Dillion also shares his experiences as G.M with the NZ Breakers through to his proudest moments in parenting.
